result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Scott Peckman

records.addlTxt: for copies filed by DOJ. jaf
filed by Atty Bjork. jaf

** AMENDED **

- Comply with terms of DJOC. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Elise T..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:37 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Cody Scott Peckman. Defendant Cody Scott Peckman in court. Atty Bjork recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to AMENDED Count 1: Disorderly Conduct WITHOUT enhancer. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court fines Defendant guilty and withholds sentence and enters 1 year DJOC. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
    Count 1:  1 Year DJOC

Apply bond on file to Atty Fees. 

Adjourned 03:46 PM

12:06 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Cody Scott Peckman. Defendant Cody Scott Peckman in court. Victim Witness in court. Court reviews case. Atty Bjork states DV assessment score was a 2. Atty Bjork states there is a resolution and requests to set for plea. Court sets PLEAS. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 01:08 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

** AMENDED**

- $250.00 Bond on file.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Elise T..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:58 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John P Bjork in court for Cody Scott Peckman. Court sets STC. Adjourned 11:07 AM

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

$250 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Elise T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:16 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Cody Scott Peckman in court. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD-PFAC given. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond argument; sidebar. Bond ordered; Court may reconsider no contact provision. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court sets STC to check status of counsel. VW states contact with victim was attempted over 6 times, but was not able to get in touch with victim.  gll
